Thanks for all the replies!

My main concern was that the faq writer for junit was pretty dogmatic
about how you were doing a terrible job if you had to do an initial
setup and couldn't use their design normally.

I thought he was being pretty unimaginative, since every scenario I
was coming across made the setUp() and tearDown() too expensive (and
quite ridiculous) to use.  All it takes is a database and distributed
computing (finding a distributed object is expensive) to blow it out
of the water in my opinion.

Again, thanks for all the replies!


--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "alpanhell" <alpanhell@y...> wrote:
> Hello,
> 
> I've just started using junit and I have a question about usage.
> 
> I'm a bit concerned that I'm not understanding something that seems
> pretty integral to the design of junit.  setUp() and tearDown() are
> called before and after every test, yet in all my TestCase's I'm
> creating I'm finding no place where I need the same setup and teardown
> before every test within that TestCase.  I can't think of very many
> scenarios where this would be useful, yet I'm finding tons of places
> where I need a one time setup and teardown for the whole TestCase.  
> 
> Am I missing something here?
> 
> thanks!
> 
> allen
